meanings.definition: (adjective) having a binding or covering of brass
meanings.sent1: The brassbound chest gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The brassbound doorknob added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The brassbound book seemed to demand attention on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: Her brassbound determination to succeed was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The brassbound bracelet jingled softly as she moved.

meanings.sent1: His brassbound rules left no room for negotiation.
meanings.sent2: The brassbound schedule allowed no room for changes.
meanings.sent3: The brassbound tree refused to sway in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her brassbound beliefs were unyielding in the face of criticism.
meanings.sent5: The brassbound gate wouldn't budge no matter how hard she pushed.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a rigid or inflexible manner
meanings.sent1: She followed the rules brassbound, never deviating from the instructions.
meanings.sent2: The old man walked brassbound down the street, refusing to stop for anyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat stared brassbound at the mouse, waiting for it to make a move.
meanings.sent4: The tree stood brassbound in the storm, unmoved by the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: He spoke brassbound, his words firm and unwavering.
